title: Question 19
prompt: Why would Lincoln stress “a new birth of freedom” and the persistence of American ideals of government in this speech?
description: Click the  <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: The underlying message of the speech is to unite the country in the cause of the Civil War. Although Lincoln is making a speech about the opening of a cemetery for fallen soldiers, he is also in the midst of a war. He want to maintain support for the Civil War. That’s why Lincoln says that “we here highly resolve that these dead shall not have died in vain.” He appeals to the people to honor the dead soldiers by uniting in support of the Civil War and the ultimate unification of the United States, which will continue the American ideals of government Lincoln talks about.
